newsitem.title: USA: COMEX copper seen opening slightly lower.
newsitem.headline: COMEX copper seen opening slightly lower.

text.p: COMEX copper futures were called to open slightly lower Tuesday in line with LME copper where trading resumed after the Easter holidays.
COMEX May copper was called unchanged to down 0.5 cent from Monday's close of 112.85 cents a lb after trading from 112.60 to 111.50 on ACCESS.
Disappointment with a smaller-than-expected draw in LME warehouse copper stocks of 6,225 tonnes saw LME three-month copper ease slightly to around $2354.0 a tonne by late morning in London.
The LME cash-to-three month spread slipped to $48.00 a tonne.
COMEX copper stocks rose 647 short tons to 43,567 short tons Monday.
COMEX May copper firmed on light volume Monday, but ran into resistance around last week's high of 113.20 cents, so some slippage Tuesday would not be unexpected, analysts said.
In addition, hopes for Chinese buying of copper now look to have been postponed until at least the end of April, traders said.
